that I endured, and I was carried out of the room in strong convulsions.<p/> <p/>A fever succeeded to this. I lay for two months on the point of death: my ravings, as I afterwards heard, were frightful; I called myself the murderer of William

restrain me from committing some dreadful act of violence.<p/> <p/>Yet one duty remained to me, the recollection of which finally triumphed over my selfish despair.
